required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DEFENDOR: A Multicenter Prospective Observational Post-registration stuDy of Extimia® (INN: empEgfilrastim) to Evaluate Efficacy and saFEty in patieNts With soliD tumORs
clinical_study.official_title: DEFENDOR: A Multicenter Prospective Observational Post-registration stuDy of Extimia® (INN: empEgfilrastim) to Evaluate Efficacy and saFEty in patieNts With soliD tumORs

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Extimia® (INN - empegfilgrastim) in reducing the frequency, duration of neutropenia, the incidence of febrile neutropenia and infections caused by febrile neutropenia in patients with solid tumours receiving myelosuppressive therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Relative dose-intensity (RDI) of the myelosupressive therapy course

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of febrile neutropenia with empegfilgrastim supportive therapy compared with historical control

The incidence of neutropenia leading to a dose reduction of cytostatic drugs and / or an increase of the interval between cycles when using empegfilgrastim supportive therapy compared with historical controls
RDI of chemotherapy courses performed in relation to nosology
RDI of chemotherapy courses performed in relation to treatment regimen
Frequency of study withdrawal due to adverse events

clinical_study.condition: Patients With Solid Tumours Who Receive Myelosupressive Therapy

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with solid tumors who have received myelosupressive therapy

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with solid tumors who have received myelosupressive therapy

study_pop.textblock: Patients with solid tumors who are prescribed myelosuppressive therapy with empegfilgrastim supportive therapy to reduce the frequency, duration of neutropenia, the incidence of febrile neutropenia (FN) and infections manifested by FN, as part of routine clinical practice according to the approved indications of the appropriate drugs.

facility.name: St. Josaphat Belgorod Regional Clinical Hospital
State Health Institution "Voronezh Region Clinical Oncology Dispansary"
